UnitType.Quote: Do not speak to me about gods.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: When he lived with his god, Gahad was a lesser seer, responsible for minor prayers around tea-time. Events saw him put in the spotlight and then cast out from the Heavens. This occured long before the other Angels were abandoned by their god. What exactly these events were, Gahad will never speak of. If pressed, he will simply state that "the gods' lessons are beautiful". Although he would never speak of it aloud, him being cast out from the Heavens and subsequently scorned by the other Angels has deeply wounded him and he feels greatly betrayed.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Through understanding we grow.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My mind is my product. You'll pay %d gildar, I know it.
UnitType.Backstory:
Before the Cataclysm, Oskaloth was famous for his lengthy discussions with the god the Angels served. During one such discussion, Oskaloth managed to enrage the god to such a degree that Oskaloth was forced, by logic, to leave the Heavens. Specifically, the god claimed that Oskaloth's lack of experience in the world of Elemental made many of his points moot. Oskaloth, now forced into a figurative corner, responded that he would go into the world and learn all about it.
Thus, before the Cataclysm, Oskaloth went into the world and walked amongst men. Sometimes he would hide his identity by cutting all the feathers from his wings and binding them to his back. As a person of great intelligence and wisdom, he was seen as a mythical entity in and of himself - a seemingly old man who walked the earths delivering justice and advice to those he saw fit.
After several hundred years in the world, Oskaloth has grown tired of the company of men. Now, Oskaloth is unable to return to the Heavens because his god is banishing all of the Angels. He seeks employment and someone who can put to use his vast knowledge of the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: You seen any demons around?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: Madun was banished from his Clan for having an inappropriate but non-sexual relationship with an under-age Centaur girl. Madun wandered the wastelands left behind by the Cataclysm until the girl came of age. Centaur tradition dictates that would be when he would be allowed to return to the Clan. He chose not to return to the Clan because he had grown to love the freedom of deciding only for himself what to do. When the War of Magic erupted, Madun searched for his Clan to rejoin them but learned that they had been eradicated by a raiding party of Chaos Legion demons. He now seeks to join forces with someone who promises the destruction of the entire Chaos Legion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: The open steppe, fleet hooves, falcons at your wrist, and the wind in your hair.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
Subolcathi, early on, showed signs of being what the Centaurs call a "lesser". A "lesser" is a Centaur that is smaller in size and doesn't show the same explosive strengths as other Centaur but make up for it in speed instead. Such Centaur were usually forcibly volunteered to join the Outriders. The Outriders were Centaur that, before the Cataclysm, patrolled the Expanse searching for invaders.
When joining the Outriders, a centaur effectively becomes clanless and abandons his old name for a new one from his brothers. Subolcathi's old name is now considered to never have existed. The name Subolcathi was chosen from an old Storm Dragon that used to terrorize the Expanse thousands of years ago.
Subolcathi was content in his role as an Outrider but left the other Centaur after Vini rose to power. The reason was Subolcathi's pride in the old traditions which Vini now neglects. Other Centaur think it strange that Subolcathi should feel so fiercely for traditions that effectively saw him banished from civil society.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Xuigoc menellter.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: A glimpse of eternity, yours for %d Gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Nightfall - or Xizx in his own tongue - is one of the Starfarers, a race of extradimensional entities that visit different worlds searching for their lost god. According to their legends, the Water Being whom they worship will engage in a titanic struggle with the Air Being at the end of all things. If the Starfarers are there to aid their god, it will be victorious and they will all ascend to another plane of existence. If the Air Being is victorious, all things shall end.
Nightfall has come to the Elemental world after sensing the Cataclysm. To his surprise, he has become separated from his brethren and he is now unable to communicate with them or travel to them. For him, this is a cause of great distress as he believes he has located the Water Being, the god sleeping within the Elemental world that caused the Cataclysm. For now, Nightfall will simply serve any master until he can amass enough power to break through whatever is blocking his exit from this world.
Starfarers exist partially outside the physical realm. They come face to face with the horrors that exist on this different plane on a daily basis. Most Starfarers are, as a result, insane.

UnitType.Quote: Sacrificial priest was my duty and honour.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I promise you honest service, for the right price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ovoz is a practitioner of Blood Magic. Normally such devotion would give him high social status within the Lizardmen society but Ovoz also is an atheist with conviction. While his brethren prefer to deliver whatever dark powers they unlock unto their gods, Ovoz wants it all for himself. Although he was not explicitly repudiated from Lizardmen culture, he felt that they were holding him back and decided to leave of his own volition.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I'm... not sure who I am.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will purchase my services.
UnitType.Backstory:
Orza is a "Twisted", an ancient Immortal warrior from the Dungeon Dimensions. The Twisted were part of a venerated warrior cult considered particularly blessed by the change of the No-god. From their back, several spines protrude that define and defend the Twisted. They are sentient and work on their own to deflect blows and ranged attacks.
Orza was wounded during the events his race suffered before the Cataclysm and lost all memory of who he used to be. His physical strength remains at peak condition and that his extra spines still function, make him a warrior to be feared on the battlefield. As he does not remember serving the No-god, his loyalties towards the Chaos Legion are non-existent.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will pay for the deaths I will bring you.
UnitType.Quote: Grrr.
UnitType.Backstory: Zajod was bred as a front-line melee fighter. Even amongst her brothers and sisters from the same brood, she quickly became known for her ferocity and ability to survive the most dangerous situations. She was cast out from her fighting unit due to being "uncontrollable" in battle when the red mist came down.

UnitType.Quote: Hunting time!
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will join your hunt!
UnitType.Backstory:
Unhappy with the firm rule of the Stormlord that saw him assigned to the despicable role of "guard duty," Ewazi left the other Drota in order to seek his own glory in the hunt. He has a quick temper but methodically prepares for any real combat engagements. A part of Ewazi also holds a grudge against the other Drota for putting his race through the cleansing in the years since the Cataclysm. The concepts remain unfamiliar to him, but he feels that his honor is perhaps stained somewhat by because he used to serve the people that raped and killed his mother.
Ewazi also has a rare talent, though he doesn't know it yet. Through mutation of the hybrid genes, he has become an Immortal, and will not age (wounds may still kill him, of course).

UnitType.Quote: Shelter me, please.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will join your hunt!
UnitType.Backstory: Hazaz is one of the few living Drota that has avoided the purge led by the Stormlord - he is not a spider hybrid like most other Drota alive today. He has managed to stay alive and avoid contact with other Drota using his exceptional skills in tracking and has a natural penchant for crafting small gadgets.

UnitType.Quote: The woods have changed.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d I will guide you into the Deep Woods.
UnitType.Backstory:
Adeamane is a Shadow Scout. The Shadow Scouts are Elves that survive in the "Deep Woods;" the dark swamps where normal Elves dare not go from fear of monsters and lethal insects.
Adeamane was born before the Cataclysm and brought up by her parents. When they were killed by a bear, Adeamane refused to let that event be a defining part of who she was and thus went into the Deep Woods to conquer her fear.
Recently, Adeamane has decided to return to society because it is clear to her that the forests will be changed from the coming battles. Unique among the Elves, Adeamane holds the belief that some monsters in the world should be killed off. She sees no "balance" between the aspects of the world like the other Elves do. Able to draw on her vast experience from living in the swamps, she now lives to teach those who will listen to survive as she did.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: All things in balance and unity.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d is the amount you will pay me.
UnitType.Backstory: Nadarien is a famous seer amongst the Elves. Profoundly in tune with the world around her, some Elves even believe she is able to see the future. Although Nadarien herself has never specifically claimed such powers, there is no doubt she is a capable magician.

UnitType.Backstory: Jamsaxa saw her entire family destroyed by the Cataclysm. Her heart is now a dark place and she weeps every night for her loss. She exists now only to destroy as many of the "damned Worldbreakers" as possible.
UnitType.Quote: I want to kill as many of the Worldbreakers as possible.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will show you the measure of my vengeance.

UnitType.Quote: Strategy and tactics are ultimately the same, like war and fighting are the same.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d Gildar I will take you with me to war.
UnitType.Backstory:
Before the Cataclysm the Frost Giants existed in a state of permanent peace among their different tribes. However, it would be amiss to say that this peace was the result of calm minds. Rather, the warriors in their societies were honored above all others because not only were they the most formidable hunters but they also ensured that no one would attack the tribe.
Thus, it fell to the Warmasters, a rank similar to General, to build the strongest, most efficient military for their tribes with the resources they had. Skrymir is one such Warmaster. He was one of the few Frost Giants that refused to acknowledge the honorary leadership given to the Frost Giant channelers after the Cataclsym. To Skrymir, this represented a weakness of the mind which he could not accept as a Warmaster. Skrymir would rather take up arms against his fellow Frost Giants than live amongst such a "weak" society. To this day Skrymir holds the belief that he rightfully belongs as leader of the Frost Giants.
Following his arrival to Elemental, Skrymir has begun to slowly learn water magic. He would never admit to this, of course.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Hard work and hard iron is what I can offer.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: The forge whispers to me. For %d I will tell you what secrets it holds.
UnitType.Backstory:
Orkoth is a famous smith from the Gnomish fortress Arak-Kazar. It was destroyed along with every other Gnome fortress during the Cataclysm. Since then, Orkoth has wandered the lands trying to find a purpose for his existence. Along with the rebirth of civilization taking place, he has rekindled his old interest of weapon- and armor-smithing. Orkoth is a master smith, one of the Forgelords of Arak-Kazar. His knowledge would be invaluable to anyone who has the foresight to recruit him.
He can be quite conventional and insists that people address him as "Orkoth, Forgelord". He is also known to throw a tantrum when those he supervises produce something that is less than perfect. Despite this, he is a supreme teacher and any who follow his rough but just guidance will soon stand out amongst the rest.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I will regain my honour one day.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My axe... for %d Gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Uras is a Gnome Slayer. He was previously a lieutenant in charge of a small band of gnomes with orders to patrol a border. Uras made a decision to pursue a Greenskin warband instead of guarding a vital point of defense. It resulted in his group being killed and the village they were defending sacked. Thus, Uras was expelled from Gnomish society. He now lives his life as a Slayer, walking the lands attempting to defeat monsters, wanting to regain his lost honor.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I remember the Long ages.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
Cosinivatha is one of the oldest Golems in all the world. Some even believe it to be older than Mankind itself. It has managed to stay intact for this long due to its ability to repair itself. Although most Golems have some basic understanding of self-repair, the variables deciding how and when to act on such impulses have been altered in Cosinivatha. Specifically, the requirements for what materials to use have been removed, which means that it is built out of an assortment of rubble, almost like a scrap Golem.
Cosinivatha is prone to introspection and only rarely speaks of its long life. It prefers to avoid any such questions by simply stating that it doesn't remember. If the circumstances are correct, it will admit to a wealth of knowledge of the past - although limited, of course, by being re-told from its own perspective. Indeed, it does remember the rise of dragons and the coming of Man.
The Golem Cosinivatha has had something of a mental rejuvenation recently. He was captured by the Golems from the White Wizard that tried to harness his regenerative powers (and they succeeded in doing so!). During that process, part of the White Wizard's Golems became imprinted onto Cosinivatha. Although he eventually escaped their imprisonment, he is now more like them than before. Being captured and experimented on has led to Cosinivatha understanding how its lack of purpose has made it a "non-entity" and rather than spend another ten thousand years waiting for new orders from its master, it has now decided to find a purpose to follow.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Today I am alone. Tomorrow? Time will tell.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Give me a lab, some servants, %d gildar and leave me to my work!
UnitType.Backstory:
Like other Obsidian Golems, Melailned was made out of lava rock and is protected by powerful enchantments against hostile magic. Melailned obtained consciousness long before those Golems that were created by the White Wizard. Born from the Anima Tsa Animana, the Spell of Life from Lifelessness, Melailned is unique even amongst other Obsidian Golems because it remembers some of the spell that called it into existence.
Since its creation, Melailned has searched for knowledge to further its own ability to create more Golems. It is capable of creating similes but they break up to ash within days. The Golem now believes that the task it has set for itself is beyond its powers and, thus, is looking for an empire to join, where it believes it can further its studies.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: *mumbles something that sounds slightly archaic*
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, we will wander the earths together.
UnitType.Backstory: Eddir was created during the Cataclysm, like most other Living Stone. However, unlike his brethren, Eddir was spawned out of a pocket of yellow sand at the Creation, instead of proper rock. This gave him a colorful appearance and a colorful youth. He was shunned by the other Living Stone for being different and he was unable to stand up for himself as his creation had rendered him significantly weaker than the others. Due to those circumstances, Eddir left the other Living Stone in order to go find his own fortune. Physically weak, he began to dabble in the arts of magic at an early age. Eddir hopes to one day return as a powerful champion to show his race how wrong they were to "banish him," as he sees it. Eddir's mind wanders easily, and no one who spent any time with him would consider him driven enough to become a powerful mage.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Violence at a point.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I will serve you as long as your cause is just.
UnitType.Backstory:
Rukre is the only Living Stone member that is not recognized by the others of the race as being a Living Stone. During the creation of the Living Stone, Rukre was separated from the others by an underground river and carried far away. He was found by a group of Crag Spawn who raised him as their own, he even took on the appearance of a Crag Spawn. Thus Rukre has inherited the violent nature of his caretakers, whom he used to join on their raids on underground mines. Rukre managed to be the only survivor after one raid went badly and all the true Crag Spawn following him were killed. He wandered the wastelands the following years and, on occasion, even tried to re-integrate himself into other Crag Spawn groups but now that he had grown up it was more than obvious he wasn't one of them. In his travels, he came across the many darker sides of living with a violent nature, primarily the suffering of children and he came to abandon it as a way of life.
Nevertheless, Rukre has never been formally accepted as a Living Stone by the others of his race and the reason is this: the Living Stone see Rukre as what they could have been if things had happened differently during the Creation. The Living Stone are perhaps too eager to cast a favorable light on their own reality in the world of Elemental. The truth is, were it not for happenstance during the Creation, they could all be beasts. This is not something the Living Stone wish to accept, rather it would be so much simpler to not recognize poor Rukre. Furthermore, there's the fact of his likeness in appearance to the Crag Spawn. Those things open up a train of thoughts the Living Stone would rather leave alone.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Like a shadow in the night.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar and my violence is yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Erik Halfhand was a Shadow Assassin before the Cataclysm. Shadow Assassins were mercenaries hired for their great skill in assassination and spying. Erik chose to give up his occupation when the Shadows formed a coherent faction because he feared if he were to be discovered it would cause issues for those of his race. He was refused re-entry into the Shadows' society due to his gruesome past. Erik now seeks to restart his career as a mercenary.

UnitType.Quote: The deep earth talks to me.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar. No more, no less.
UnitType.Backstory: Normally, Shadows have no memory of what their life was like when they lived as two-dimensional beings anchored to the living. The Shadow known as Nightsister is unique among the Shadows because she alone retains memories from before she was created. Her "parent" was an old magician that performed many ill deeds leading up to the Cataclysm. The entity known as Nightsister now feels she must atone for the sins of her past - even though it was not her that committed them. For this reason, Nightsister has embarked on a personal crusade against the Empires of Elemental.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: For the last time, I don't eat brains.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar. And I don't eat brains.
UnitType.Backstory: When the Skeleton King was born, Lanix was already dying from a terrible flesh eating virus. Lanix was turned undead at the very brink of death. Somehow, combining with the virus raging his body, he became something else from the others that were turned undead. Lanix' flesh stayed on his body and he exhibited a strange craving for living flesh. Lanix was the first zombie, although, unlike those that followed after, he kept his mind intact. He has loyalty to no faction; he will follow anyone as long as it means a steady supply of flesh to consume. Other undead look down on Lanix with scorn as he is less than their "purer" form. He could not care less.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar is a small price to put on what I can do for you and yours.
UnitType.Quote: To me, the world simply makes sense.
UnitType.Backstory: Okraxar has a mighty mind and was part of the Skeleton King's court when the King was resurrected. The King chose to have Okraxar retain his independent mind because the King feared Okraxar's talents would be spoiled by the invasive dark magic used to turn him into an Undead. However, the plan backfired when Okraxar turned against the King following Okraxar's family's turning into mindless skeletons. Originally he conspired to overthrow the King but chose to flee when he realized the King's command over the mindless skeletons was complete and could not be interrupted.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Zalos was a powerful Air wizard that fell under the thumb of the Skeleton King when "it" rose to power. Zalos was able to escape capture by the King's minions for a long time using his magical skills. Eventually, he agreed to be turned on the condition that he would be free to pursue his own fortune. The King broke the promise and after the turning imprisoned Zalos for one hundred years to "teach him some manners". Zalos escaped.

UnitType.Quote: Have you seen any like me before?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Our howls as one, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ankis is a one-of-a-kind Wolfman. His true origins are unknown. He was found in the barren wastes as a child-pup by merchants passing through. His knack for controlled violence meant he was a natural companion to the merchants as a bodyguard. As time passed, they accepted him as one of their own and taught the ways of the world. Eventually, his own personality started to emerge; a freedom-loving young Wolfman with a capacity to see things through to the end. He loathes injustice in all of its forms.

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar will show that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: Pekelo has made it his mission in life to travel among other the other peoples of Elemental as a kind of emissary to let others know what the Living Stone are like. He is not acting in an official capacity, merely following his chosen path. Ironically, he's somewhat out of touch with others of his kind, as he's been away more than he's been among them. As one example, Pekelo tends to wear more clothing than most of his kind, in an attempt to appear modest in front of other races. Most Living Stone, however, wear little in the way of clothing aside from the occasional ornamental cloak, save that which is necessary for protection or the pursuit of their profession.

UnitType.Quote: Zlat-tenq knows the value of a good upbringing, yes I do.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I promise you honest service, for the right price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: For many years, Zlat-tenq was responsible for running the primary hatchery and creche of the lizardmen. Now that she has grown old and frail, her people have turned her out. Zlat-tenq claims she still has a number of years of service left in her, though, and cackles that she knows a few tales from various lizards' youths that some would prefer to remain untold.

UnitType.Quote: My might in battle is well worth your gildar.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will purchase my services.
UnitType.Backstory: While the Chaos Legion are raised from birth to serve unquestioningly, their chaotic nature ensures that from time individuals will diverge from the group. Under the authority of the No-God, this tendency was much reduced, and any signs of dissension or disloyalty were quickly noticed and brutally quashed. Since the No-God's demise, however, the number of cases have increased. Ehpaxor is one of these. While his patrol camped on a recent scouting foray, Ephaxor took the opportunity to slip away and go absent without leave; he is now seeking his fortune as a mercenary.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Togetherness.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d I will guide you into the Deep Woods.
UnitType.Backstory:
It is common for Elven magicians to try to immerse themselves in their environment in a spiritual way by meditating in places filled with life. This helps them achieve the mind-world unity they so strive for - to be aware of all things is required to fully appreciate the gift of life. This ability is highly prized in the Elvish society and normally, a truly honed empathic ability would have marked Companion out as a leader.
Companion has unfortunately taken this philosophy too far. She has so honed her empathic abilities and spent so much time immersed in the meditative trance that she has essentially lost her own personality. Her tremendously open mind and spirit makes it a pure pleasure to be in her presence because she can offer unconditional love to all living things. For this reason she has become adored by elementals and forest creatures alike. When it comes to making decisions and carrying them out, Companion is of no use to anyone.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Let us begin the chase!
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will join your hunt!
UnitType.Backstory:
While the Drota are famed for their passion for hunting all other races, they are not loathe to hunt their own on occasion, and in fact have various rituals in which a member of the tribe is hunted; the lethality of the hunt depends on the particular ritual. Jidawa was recently selected as the quarry for one such ritual hunt, but was unwilling to submit to being 'prey'; he managed to escape before the hunt began in earnest by feigning sleep after having been given a sedative concoction (Jidawa's spider-hybrid genes have granted him a strong natural defense against poisons of all kinds, and a mystical ability to apply venom to his weapons.)
Since this effectively banishes him from his tribe, he is now seeking to hunt with another.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d Gildar I will fight for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Yes, I was cast out of my tribe for transgressions I will not discuss with you. That was before the dark times, and none of my tribe survived the sundering of the lands that came. Yet those of my race whom I have met still call me outcast; I pay them no mind, other than to show them my steel.

UnitType.Quote: I can see why weapons and armor sell so well here.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My axe... for %d Gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Raina is the youngest child and only daughter of a large family in a small clan that specializes in armorsmithing. She has decided to hazard some adventure in order to gain appreciation for the practical aspects of the family craft, and also to raise her stature within the clan. She has not revealed her magical talents to her family, as she feels that this would somehow be "cheating".

UnitType.Quote: Did you know that people are a beautiful red color inside?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would let me purchase more red things.
UnitType.Backstory:
Ruby was once a White Golem nearly identical to the rest of her kind. Not long after Lochean began assembling the remainder of the White Golems to begin their empire, Ruby was sent as an emissary to a sorceress reputed to have extensive knowledge of golems. When Ruby arrived, she discovered that this was indeed the case. The sorceress had a wide array of golems who were serving in various capacities in her tower. While Ruby noted this for later action when a task force could be spared for their recovery, her primary mission was to negotiate for transfer of knowledge, and she quickly set about her task. It proved difficult, however, to keep the sorceress focused on the negotiations. In addition to the normal biological functions such as eating and sleeping that she knew to expect, the sorceress would also frequently leave to observe some natural phenomena, such as small bird-animals resupplying their energy by feeding at plants in the garden, or the light patterns on clouds when the day period was ending. It was exceedingly hard to predict and even harder for her to understand. When she asked the other golems about it, they either ignored her or gave illogical answers of the kind one might expect from a mortal.
Realizing that she was not accomplishing her task, Ruby decided to speak to the sorceress about the matter so that they could proceed. She asked the sorceress to explain the nature and reason behind the deviations, so that she could anticipate them and plan for more efficient use of her time. The sorceress agreed, though she said that the process may take longer than Ruby anticipated, and that the outcome might not be what she expected. Ruby considered, and decided that the risk was negligible, while the potential benefits of obtaining the knowledge were great, as were the consequences of failure if she returned without the information. She agreed. The sorceress smiled, took hold of Ruby's hands, and led her outside to begin her education.
It did indeed take longer than Ruby had anticipated, and when the sorceress had finished explaining, some months had passed. Ruby found that she no longer cared to return to the other golems with the information; it would be of no use to them. She understood what the other golems in the sorceress' residence were doing there; they were not slaves, but rather had found a tutor for knowledge that no one else could or would teach. The sorceress' power over golems was skill in empathy and a gift for instruction, not special magical knowledge. Furthermore, she had come to appreciate beauty in the world. Especially the color red. In fact, she had so much come to appreciate the color red that she took a new name after a stone with that color.
For all this, though, she was not willing to stay with the sorceress indefinitely. She found that she did not appreciate the same things, that she had her own sense of taste and style. She determined that she would see what other beauty the world had to offer, and that she would acquire the means to collect what she desired. She knew that she would be able to employ her capabilities to earn gildar, with which she could purchase beautiful things from others. Or she could take them by force should she obtain a position of power over them. She also understood that this would not be as easy among her own kind, who do not appreciate beauty in the way she does now. Therefore, she would set out on her own.
Before she left, she asked a boon of the sorceress; she wished to be as red as her namesake. The sorceress granted her wish, and today Ruby is still bright red, as you can see.

UnitType.Quote: For people like us, nothing is beyond reach.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, we will wander the earths together.
UnitType.Backstory: Early on Jilbin showed signs of being a remarkable wizard. Instead of staying with other Living Stone to further explore her abilities, she decided to venture out into the world. However, the Jilbin of today is a very different person altogether. She is covered in magical runes and seems emotionally distant as to the fate of her people. Something happened when she was out pursuing her own destiny - something that granted her terrifying powers. She will not respond to most common social interactions but if coaxed can speak for hours about how "time dances" or how the "stars are singing". She has clearly gone a little insane on her travels. If left alone she will spend days looking into mirrors. For what reason? Only she knows.

Stone himself seldom argues; he's much more likely to settle grievances with blows. One might assume that he'd suffered a few too many knocks to the head, but it's unclear if that even affects Shadows in the same way as normal races.

UnitType.Backstory: The Shrillguard are rumored to originate from a place spoken about only in myth and legend: the infamous Northern Wastes. They were supposedly forged there by Vetrar, the Guardian of the World's End, to serve as his lieutenants. The Shrillguard rebelled against Vetrar and hunted down by his minions, but a few escaped the wrath of the frozen god.

UnitType.Backstory: In an attempt to create better undead soldiers, the Skeleton King tried to infuse his undead progeny with an even greater lust for death. Although he was successful in a way, the experiment was ultimately a failure. The Death Knights were the result - emanating an aura of absolute fear, their hate for all living things made them practically uncontrollable. They no longer obeyed the commands of the Skeleton King and breaking free from his powerful grip, they went out into the world to kill all that they could.

While the burns have healed, the magical energies present during the incident have darkened his complexion quite a bit, and have left him preternaturally attuned to fires both natural and mystical in origin.

UnitType.Quote: The only good greyskin is one that's serving as the crows' feast.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: Once Jareb was a simple warrior, undistinguished within his tribe. Then one day, a passing Kraxian merchant caravan stopped to trade. Along with the caravan rode a robed woman on horseback. Jareb made an offhand comment to the effect that the horse would be better left to its freedom. Whatever the reason, the comment enraged the woman, who turned out to be a mage of some power. While the rest of his tribe observed in awe, she used powerful magics that blew all that surrounded her back several paces and forced Jareb to fall to the ground before her; she dismounted and placed her foot on his prostrate form, then with glowing fingers wrote a word on his flank; she stated that the word meant 'servant' in a forgotten tongue. Sure enough, Jareb found himself unable to resist her command, and he was forced to do her bidding for the rest of the day, and later to serve shamefully as her mount when the caravan left. The next day she commanded him to return to his people, which he obediently did. When he returned, the effect and the magical inscription eventually wore off, but it was all he could do to face the stares and snickers of the other warriors of his tribe. After an incident in which he severely assaulted a female of the tribe for a perceived slight, he was encouraged to leave and find his peace. Jareb has never returned to his tribe and instead nurses his grudge, gradually expanding his acrimony and resentment toward all women and Fallen.

UnitType.Quote: I can sink this arrow into the eye of a desert rat a field's length away. Men are considerably larger than desert rats.

UnitType.Backstory: At a young age, Seham's original tribe was decimated by a group of Quendar; he and his mother were enslaved for a number of years and made to act as beasts of burden, a time that he resents greatly. They were later adopted into a different centaur tribe that in turn raided the Quendar. While he managed to earn the respect of his new tribe's warriors with his deadly aim and hunting skill, he never felt fully integrated. That might have something to do with why he left to make his own fortune. Seham says that he's happier on his own, though he does complain incessantly about other races' use of horses as mounts and beasts of burden, claiming that it's somehow akin to slavery. He's willing to put up with it, though, so long as he doesn't see them being mistreated. In that case, his fury can be unsettling.

UnitType.Backstory: On one of the first post-Cataclysm expeditions of the lizardfolk from their cave refuges back into the surrounding swamps, Chigar was bitten by a strange insect and developed a disease. The rest of the expedition left him there to die, but Chigar eventually recovered, albeit with some side effects that still trouble him from time to time. Chigar claims that while he lay in the swamp, he was visited by a giant, black and purple, winged snake who told him that he was destined for greatness in battle, and that he should not rely on the priests any longer. While his strength and confidence in battle are self-evident, it's clear that his thoughts are not entirely unmuddled, and his blood-lust is unsettling.

UnitType.Quote: Never leave a loaded crossbow pointing in your own direction.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will purchase my services.
UnitType.Backstory: After establishing their foothold on this side of the dimension gate, the Chaos Legion undertook some experiments to try to make use of the local population as hosts in order to more rapidly increase their numbers. Most of these experiments were unsuccessful and the outcomes destroyed. Iozihr, however, managed to slip away when he emerged from a pupa-like casing while his guards were away. Ironically, in his case the eventual results could have been viewed as a success, as he is essentially similar to other members of the Chaos Legion save for some peculiarities of appearance, which hardly unites the Legion overall. However, his experiences have left him with no love or loyalty toward the Legion. Since his escape, he's managed to make use of his extraordinary natural reflexes working as a hired blade and assassin.

UnitType.Quote: A shrewd hunter ensures that there will be sufficient quarry for the next hunt, as well.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will join your hunt!
UnitType.Backstory: Given their great passion for hunting, larger Drota settlements tend to quickly depopulate any quarry from the surrounding lands. As such, they have recently begun captive breeding programs to ensure that prey exists to be hunted when desired, at least for those of means. Yqaesi was one of the first such Gamekeepers, and is quite adept at managing the incessant demands to release 'just one more' against the needs of maintaining a viable supply of captive stock, and applying the appropriate political pressure to ensure that no one faction hoards the game supply to themselves. Nonetheless, she managed to annoy the wrong party at the wrong time by refusing to supply a captive Gnomish youth for a 'blooding' ceremony for a powerful Drota commander's favored offspring. Sensing that her own well-being was in danger, she set loose the entire captive stock as a diversion and made her escape. She now seeks to apply her skills at 'grooming the stock' elsewhere.

UnitType.Quote: You may take the remaining woodlands and build a bonfire, for all that I care.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d I will share my dark secrets with you.
UnitType.Backstory:
The Cataclysm affected Angolon differently than other elves. While most elves see the damage caused by those times as a cause for grief, Angolon instead saw the change as a chance to break with the old traditions and dependencies on nature's capricious cycles, to overturn the old taboos, and to build a new, modern elvish nation. Initially he tried convincing others, but as each in turn gave him reactions ranging from apathetic depression to outright disgust, he grew embittered. More and more, he kept away from other elves, and even made travels into nearby Fallen towns in search of new options and kindred spirits.
As he continued his pursuit of new ways to build a modern elvish nation, he came into contact with a sorcerer who claimed that he could show Angolon new methods that would prove to the other elves the efficacy of his ideas. Under the tutelage of this sorcerer, Angolon pursued research into the technologies and magics introduced by the titans. Eventually, the sorcerer revealed himself as a demon, and indicated that Angolon would need to choose whether to continue on the path that they had started, or to end their arrangement. He gladly accepted the demon's offer of continued training; in exchange, he would only have to embed a sliver of a death shard into the oldest oak in his home forest. Thinking that nothing could be more easy, Angolon quickly returned to the grove of his elders and accomplished the feat. As soon as he did so, a great change came over that section of forest, and it began to shrivel and die before his eyes. Other elves soon came rushing up, then fell to their knees, sobbing, as they witnessed the change. By this point, Angolon felt nothing but disdain for his own kind, like a noble among lesser beings. He smirked as he walked past his stunned kinsfolk out of the grove, never to return.
Upon returning to the study where he had left the demon sorcerer, he found that his tutor had departed, leaving behind only a sealed scroll. Angolon broke the seal and studied the contents. Eventually, he decided to recite the incantation within. No sooner was the incantation completed than the scroll evaporated in a burst of green flames. He felt a strange pull at his body, as if he were somehow being stretched...and then, nothing, except a strange pit of emptiness. He soon discovered, however, that there was a physical manifestation of the event; his skin is now as dark as his soul.

UnitType.Quote: Like a moth to the flame...what? No, I didn't mean me!
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: At his birth, the midwife had a premonition that Ceredirnor would do "great things" with fire. Perhaps it it wasn't quite what she had in mind when, as an infant, Ceredirnor knocked over a candle and set his dwelling ablaze. Ceredirnor did survive, obviously, but ever after the incident, he has been strangely affected by fire; whereas most elves tend to avoid fire when possible due to its tendency to get out of control and cause unintended damage, Ceredirnor remains fascinated by it, as his constantly singed fingers will attest. Despite, or maybe because of, his many fire related injuries, Ceredirnor has a certain way with flames. While he can coax more out of a fire spell than most, he's constantly having small 'accidents' that result in this or that being singed or charred; this tends to put other elves on edge. More than once he's been asked, with varying degrees of politeness, to cease his incendiary pursuits.

Rather than dwell on what has been lost, she has taken the opportunity to strike out and make a name for herself.

UnitType.Backstory: Brodd is small, even for a Gnome. He's also a Gnome totally without any sense of morality or honor. Long ago evicted from his clan's stead, he quickly moved from a life of petty thievery on to a variety of positions in various Kraxian criminal organizations, where he put his small size to profitable use when slipping into locations he was not supposed to be. Despite, or perhaps because of, his small size compared to most of his fellow scoundrels, he's developed a reputation for a nasty temper, extreme viciousness, and cruelty, with quite a number of broken kneecaps to back up the reputation.

UnitType.Quote: This would work so much better if you try it this way.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Give me a factory, some servants, %d gildar and leave me to my work!
UnitType.Backstory:
Coggs was once used to provide the force to turn a huge wheel in a machine to manufacture metal goods. Day after day, Coggs would tirelessly tread in a circle, pushing the large drive-wheel round and round. Eventually, the soot, grease, and grime from the machine, the nearby ovens, and the generally filthy working conditions stained him nearly black. It was mindless work; Coggs was no more than a part of the machine.
This isn't to say that Coggs' mind was idle during that time, however. When he was liberated and given free will by a group of White Golems, Coggs let them know that he had thought of countless ways to improve the efficiency of the operation while he had been observing it as he turned the wheel. The other golems listened, but directed him to travel to their city for 'processing'. Coggs did so, but when he arrived, none of the other golems seemed interested. When he explained his ideas to the golem in charge of the 'processing' operation, the information was noted and Coggs was assigned to work in a production facility. Essentially, he found himself doing menial labor again. As he worked, he began thinking of ways to improve efficiency once again. He explained these to the supervisor golem, but the supervisor golem informed Coggs that his role was to produce, and that another golem would be responsible for such innovations if warranted.
This seemed inefficient to Coggs, and, now that he has free will, he has decided to leave to see if he can find someone to listen to and implement his ideas.

UnitType.Quote: Don't bother voicing your objections; I've already got responses to all of them here.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I'll make sure things get done around here.
UnitType.Backstory: As they were building their new society, the Living Stone had to learn new ways of doing things that most other races take for granted, including how to work together in a common society, how an economy should work, who decides what gets done, by whom, and when, etc. Mola was instrumental in pushing her people to decide upon and implement these policies. This relentless pushing has earned her the nickname 'the millstone' for the way she can relentlessly grind down objections to getting things done. Perhaps she's been a bit too relentless, as she's now seeking to employ her administrative skills at large.

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar. No more, no less.
UnitType.Backstory: Perhaps there was some variation in the light during her making, but Pernicia is insubstantial, even for a shadow. She was, for a time, a professional courier, specializing in carrying messages that parties didn't want to be seen having sent or received. She also worked briefly as a stage dancer in a less than savory establishment, but she was let go because her act was too subtle for the regular clientèle. Now she's seeking to utilize her remarkable fluidity in a rather more dangerous line of employment.

UnitType.Quote: Please, look past my outward appearance and let me help restore that which has been defiled.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar will pay for expenses.
UnitType.Backstory: Cormath was one of the five magicians who sacrificed themselves in order to resurrect the Fifth Patriach, who became the Skeleton King. His body was discarded after the unholy ritual, but after a number of years his spirit re-inhabited the now skeletal remains, perhaps called back by the various necromantic magics being practiced on a frequent basis in the kingdom. Unlike the vast majority of the undead, who are created in special binding rituals, Cormath has retained his mental faculties and self-will. Horrified to find his new condition, and even more aghast upon learning the results of his sacrifice, Cormath fled the lands of the Skeleton King. He was to find little shelter in the lands of the living where most assumed, with understandable caution, that he was a vengeful spirit. With no particular need for food or shelter, though, he has been roaming the wastes, seeking a means to repair the curse that he unwittingly helped unleash upon the land; he feels that perhaps if he does so, then his spirit may at last rest in peace.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: You'd think that with no flesh I wouldn't feel cold any longer. Well, you'd be wrong, damn it all.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar will pay for expenses.
UnitType.Backstory: Long ago, the magician Ekorth was imprisoned in a giant magical block of ice by the titan Utheron (apparently this titan had a penchant for such things, as tales of others sharing Ekorth's predicament are not unknown.) This block was discovered by the Skeleton King's forces during an excavation project. After ascertaining that Erkoth was still alive, although very bored and extremely out of touch with current affairs, the necessary rituals for undead conversion were performed while a means to extricate him was found. Apparently the magical ice must have either had some transmutive or shielding properties that preserved Ekorth's self-will, as upon his release the somewhat less than grateful Ekorth decided to depart and find out what had gone on during his imprisonment. Since that point, Ekorth has discovered that his long imprisonment in ice has increased his affinity toward cold magics, although if asked he says he'd trade it all to be able to enjoy the comforts of a good meal and a warm nap by the fire, pleasures denied him in his current state of existence.

UnitType.Backstory: Oran is driven by a deep and compelling need to reclaim and repair the world torn asunder by the Cataclysm. To Oran, the theosophical questions facing his people are secondary to the need to actively work to cleanse the taint of the Titans' damage to the world, and to restore it to its former beauty and vigor. Oran desire is so overwhelming that he would gladly sacrifice his own well being to bring it about.

UnitType.Quote: I would travel among your people, for a time.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
Ayman's tale is one of survival through fortune in the face of overwhelming odds. As a youngling, he was abandoned on the ravaged plains when his clan, on the brink of starvation, determined that they could not feed the entire group. He was found by a passing human traveller who took pity on him and fostered him until his adolescence. At that time, however, his foster family's homestead was attacked by wildings and burned while he was out hunting small game; he was the only survivor. Upon returning to the scene of destruction, Ayman quickly picked up what he could salvage from the rubble, and determined to revenge himself on the wildings. He galloped in a fury after their warband and caught up to them as they neared their village. Perhaps it was the novelty of the sight of the lone charging centaur youth, or perhaps they were merely unwary in the exuberance of their victorious raid, but none stopped him as he galloped into their midst and trampled down the leader of the warband, killing him. At this point, he collapsed, exhausted. The wildings did not slay Ayman, though, as their custom dictated that one who defeats the chieftain in combat should be the new chieftan. After he regained his composure and breath, he warily determined that the rest of the wildings were submitting to him. His fury spent, and not having a life to return to, he remained with them and learned their ways, especially those of their shaman, a wizened crone of peculiar humor and an insatiable appetite for mushrooms. He would frequently roam the wildlands with the old shaman on his back cracking jokes, ever in search of the best spots for the elusive fungus. After two years' time, he left the wildings to undertake a shamanic vision quest and never returned. He will not speak of what she saw or heard, but Ayman claims that he gained great mystic understanding during the journey.
Sometime after his vision quest, Ayman ended up wandering near the edges of one of the few remaining patches of forest. Unaccustomed to such sights, he entered the forest where he encountered the sight of an elf child being attacked by a giant spider. Ayman rushed to help the child, but while he successfully slew the spider, he was bitten in the process and fell into a deep coma. While he was unconscious, the elf child raced to her village and returned with her elders, who were able to transport Ayman back to their village and nurse him back to health. In gratitude, the elves invited Ayman to stay with them, which he did for a season, and then granted him the best bow in their village as a token of esteem when he left.
Since that time, Ayman has moved about, living with a variety of peoples, and has developed very tolerant and expansive views as a consequence. He's extraordinarily good at mediating disputes, having a wealth of background insight to draw from. If he has any faults or biases, it is a dislike for his own people and their misogynistic tendencies.

Recently, this led to an altercation when the son of a tribal elder compared Kerbasi's battle lust to that of the trogs (a not entirely unfair comparison, if truth be told.) Kerbasi now seeks redemption through feats of battle and conquest.

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d Gildar I will join your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: Before the Cataclysm, Orvandil undertook a great voyage to see what other peoples the world contained. He roamed far and wide, and became disenchanted with the ways of his people and their disregard for all 'lesser' beings. Since the time of the Cataclysm, he has learned of his peoples' migration and plans to colonize the lands to the south. Now, he seeks to stand as a shining example to others that not all frost giants are evil beings bent on destruction and freezing the world. Which is not to say he's a pacifist; Orvandil long ago earned the respect due to a skilled Giant warrior.

UnitType.Quote: The light of day is harsh, but I can be harsher.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will draw blood in your name for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Xholotta is an albino lizardman. This is generally portended as being destined for a great fate, either for good or ill. It also makes one an excellent candidate for blood sacrifice, as one represents great potential. Never the fool, Xholotta slipped away from her people at an early age. Since that time, she's learned that compared to life in the caves of the Lizardmen, life under the naked sun is not kind to her albino skin, and she keeps herself covered whenever possible; in fact, she's much more vulnerable to extremes of heat or cold of any kind than most of her people. She's developed her natural magical talents, and keeps herself well employed utilizing them. As to whatever great fate she may be destined, only time will tell.

UnitType.Quote: A strategic retreat now may allow the wise general to choose a more advantageous position later.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will purchase my services.
UnitType.Backstory: When the Chaos Legion refugees emerged on the far side of the dimension gates, there were some understandable moments of chaos in the fog of war. During one such moment, Adarazoch deigned to give an order to a superior who far outranked him. Such a breach of command is punishable by painful, prolonged torture, generally followed by the most excruciating means of execution available. Upon recognizing his mistake and before his superior officer could react, Adarazoch quickly set a nearby building ablaze as a diversion, hamstrung his commander, and fled into the night. Cognizant that he cannot run forever, Adarazoch has elected to find another army to join so as to provide support when his former superior inevitably comes looking.

UnitType.Quote: The hunt is only sporting when the prey is worthy.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I hunt your foes.
UnitType.Backstory: Most Drota have wide ranging tastes in quarry; Xazisi specializes in the hunting of sentient beings, and nearly always hunts alone. While her skill is quite respected, the fact that she will also occasionally hunt other Drota, even outside of special ritual ceremonies, has led to 'disagreements' with her own people. Now Xazisi seeks new hunting grounds for her favorite prey.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I long for the high seas...but seeing as the art of shipbuilding has apparently been lost, perhaps you'd have me travel with you?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
While most elves keep to the deep woods, some feel the call of the seas, and Calaeron was raised by one such group who dwelt near the shores. In his younger days he had studied the magical arts but at the time of the events known as the Cataclysm, Calaeron, tired of academic pursuits, had taken up the sailor's life and was sailing far from home. When, after many delays and misadventures resulting from the chaos of the magical upheval, his badly damaged vessel was finally able to return home, the crew found that the entire city had been swept into the sea. They travelled on, and eventually put into the barely surviving remains of a port town controlled by what would become the nation of Krax. Their vessel was confiscated, and the crew, much dispirited, dispersed. Calaeron himself determined to make his way back to other elves, but was delayed for many years when he was entrapped by a Fallen sorceror who wished to study his immortal nature. Unable to escape his magical confinement, Caleaeron spent most of the time in silent meditation, much to the consternation of the sorceror. Luckily for Calaeron, it seems the sorceror never suspected Calaeron's great magical powers, or else the tortures and experimentation he was subjected to from time to time would surely have been much worse.
Recently his captor died of old age, releasing Calaeron from his imprisonment. Continuing his former journey, he eventually came into contact with the remainder of the elves but discovered that his people have changed in their outlook, which he finds disturbing. Further, none of the seafaring elves he knew are among them. After a period in which he wandered aimlessly along the shore in solitude, Calaeron has decided to find a group to belong to again.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: It's hard to say whether I like fire or gold better. Maybe molten gold?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My magic... for %d Gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Fraener is a Gnome of two loves - fire and gold. Irascible, unabashedly greedy, and constantly blackend by soot from his firey experimentations, Fraener is not a guest you'd invite to a courtly gathering. He's also quite short, even for a gnome. Whether this is due to many long hours hunched over crucibles inhaling toxic smokes wwhile searching for the secrets of alchemy, or whether it's a hereditary condition, it is impossible to say.
A recent incident involving a conflagration that engulfed his clan's storehouse led to his expulsion from the community. While unlovable, he's undeniably an asset in any confrontation where his skill with firey magics may be brought to bear.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Some say war is luck; I say a leader determines whether her troops rout or rally through proper leadership and training.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My hammer... for %d Gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Hulda is a compact package of military genius. From an early age she devoured games of strategy, besting all who would challenge her. Shortly after she came of age, she undertook the rites to bear the StoneHeart rune, an honor reserved for few. While perhaps not the most burly warrior on the field, she certainly knows how to swing a mace. Her true strength, however, is in the tactics and strategy of war. She dreams of a time of generals and massive armies so that she may employ her true talents.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Disassemble? No disassemble.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar required for repairs and maintenance.
UnitType.Backstory:
There are few creatures on Elemental that are able to withstand more damage than an Iron Golem. Long have they stood silent, patient sentries over their charges.
In the case of the golem known as Rusty, that has been a very long time indeed. Rusty was created as a war machine in the time of the great wars leading up to the Cataclysm. He does not remember that time, but he knows that he was damaged then, disabled and left forgotten on the battlefield like so much detritus. Eventually, after many seasons, a group of humans came and built a village where the battle had been. Rusty was too big to move easily, so they left him and he quickly became a fixture of the town square, where he gained his name due to the stains of rust accumulated in years of neglect out in the open. The humans of the village wove him into their lives, and would invoke him almost as a guardian spirit or witness, saying things like "that's between you, me, and Rusty over here", or "I guess I'd better do it - no use waiting on old Rusty here to get up and do it."
One day, a small group of the White Golems came to the village. They immediately recognized that Rusty's animating force was still active, and that he could be repaired enough to move, although not perhaps restored to full capacity. They quickly moved toward him and began poking and prodding him to assess his condition. When the villagers protested, the White Golems attacked, slaying most and putting the rest to flight, burning the village. Rusty, unable to do anything but mutely observe, watched it all happen. After disposing of the villagers, the White Golems returned to the repairs, explaining their purpose and community as they worked. In a few days, as they neared completion, they performed the rituals to grant Rusty free will, assuming that he would join them. Nothing was further from Rusty's mind.
The rituals and explanations were a success, in that Rusty had been given the power of self-determination and sense of self-identity. What the White Golems had not anticipated was that in the long years standing witness in the village square, Rusty had formed an attachment to the village; as much as he was capable of, he loved the village. He belonged to the village, and the village belonged to him. He was a part of their community. And the White Golems had destroyed it and its people.
While it would be inaccurate to say that Rusty burned with rage, or that his grief rushed out in anger, for he does not feel emotions in that way, nonetheless he was ruthless as he rapidly and methodically demolished the small band of White Golems. And then he walked out of the village, seeking another community to join.

UnitType.Quote: Once I traveled to the crater of a volcano to watch the lave boil. It was magnificent!
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar will light my fire.
UnitType.Backstory: Among the Living Stone, Tichon is one of the most restless and aggressive; he explains that he feels more of the fire than the stone in him. Perhaps this is what has led him to leave his nascent community to seek adventure in the untamed lands, but whatever the reason, Tichon has certainly been one of the most visible of his kind due to his wide travels and adventures.

UnitType.Quote: Judge not, lest ye be judged in kind.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar and I'll set your cities straight.
UnitType.Backstory: Some authority figures have ruled from behind shadowy masks. In the case of the the shadow known only as the Judge, that would be utterly redundant. Regardless, the Judge is widely known for his capabilities as a wise, fair, and utterly ruthless administrator and arbiter. Until recently, the Judge has primarily been in charge of running the shadows' "reclamation" program, but he has recently left that in the hands of his personally trained deputy, and is seeking to employ his talents elsewhere.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Do you really think that it matters whether I'm alive or dead when my knife is at your throat?
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar will purchase my services.
UnitType.Backstory:
Faxia was once the favored daughter of one of the Fifth Patriarch's nobles. As it became rapidly apparent what was happening in the kingdom, her father tried to rally support to stage a coup. As a backup plan in case of his failure, he paid for a protective ward from a foreign magician to protect Faxia's spirit from the spells of the Skeleton King. Unfortunately for the noble, his plan came to naught and he was converted like the rest of the ruling caste. Unfortunately for Faxia, the ward also failed to prevent her own conversion to an undead state. It did, however, have an effect, in that she retained her free will and memories of her former life, as well as some lingering minor protections. Embittered by her fate, and not wanting to test whether the ward would last, she left the kingdom.
When she left, she soon discovered that she was unwelcome in most other lands. Eventually she was taken in by a broad-minded shadow, who also happened to be an assassin. Faxia apprenticed herself to the assassin, figuring that if she couldn't live her own life, she could at least earn a living taking lives from others. In time she proved to have quite the natural talent; also, she learned, looking like death itself isn't really a social disadvantage in the assassins' trade.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Please.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: Nura had always been a timid, fragile being, and during the period in which the Angels were cast out from their mountain home, Nura happened to find herself in a predicament where she was threatened by a stray assassin demon. Nura was overwhelmed with fear and doubt. While these emotions were no doubt common to many at the time, Nura's response was to reach inside herself and cry out with her very essence for aid and assistance. To her complete and utter shock, a being of energy and light appeared and drove away the demon. Perhaps the One God had heard her and took pity on her, or perhaps she had merely tapped the channellers' ability to summon creatures from beyond, but since that point she has had always been able to summon aid in her hour of need.

UnitType.Quote: Submission is folly. I can further my ends through you, however.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You'll pay %d gildar, I know it.
UnitType.Backstory: Before the Cataclysm, Yanai was seen as one of the Angels' god's most beloved and faithful subjects. In some way, however, the events of that time are somehow tied to him, and he will not speak of it, other than to curse the name of the god he once served, and to work against the goals of his people whenever the opportunity arises.
