UnitType.Quote: Our fates, both weal and woe, are written in the stars. I've had my share of each.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show me that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: From an early age, Bimun showed great promise, and his tribe's shaman took him under his wing for special tutelage. His promise came to fruition, and he began to show talents for harnessing magic. Never ones to waste a good tool, the tribe gave him every opportunity to put those talents to use. Unfortunately, using the kind of talents Bimun possesses tends to lead to dangerous encounters. Over the years, Bimun has had more than his share of injuries. Now he is looking to join a group that can offer some protection and backup, as well as employ his unique skills.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: From an early age, Finbar became known for his striking appearance. He grew up feeling somewhat excluded, but instead of becoming depressed, he turned it into a motivation to succeed, and has become known as a fair and just champion of the people. He is one of the youngest gnomes ever to have completed the initiation rites to bear the gnomish runes.
UnitType.Quote: My hammer will strike for great justice!
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll follow you on the righteous path, but I need %d to cover expenses.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory:
During the events of the Cataclysm, the Living Stone known as Doctor had the horror to witness the merciless slaying of an Ironeer slave at the hands of a Sion commander. The slave had been chained to the very outcropping of stone from which Doctor first emerged from the earth. The Sion sliced the slave's throat, splashing blood all over Doctor while he watched, unseen, in nascent horror. As soon as the Sion strode away, Doctor emerged and bent over the stricken, dying slave. He had no idea what to do to help, no words for the emotions he felt, no way of knowing if this was 'normal' or exceptional. That experience has resonated through him to this day, and Doctor is tirelessly driven to seek out knowledge of the healing arts and employ them to heal and protect those that have been damaged by the evils of the times whenever possible. As such, rather than stay safe within the insular community that the Living Stone have formed, he wanders in strange lands, among strange peoples, where his fame as a healer extends far and wide. Once, he stopped to provide aid to a dying magician, who gave him his treasured Ereog's token, along with a compulsion never to let go of it (for he knew Doctor would otherwise have sold it for alms.)
Doctor now seeks a patron to continue his mission.
UnitType.Quote: I feel thankful that I am here to welcome you.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar will buy supplies to aid the unfortunate.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Oh, yesss...I sssupposse you might wisssh to leave while I enjoy my...sssupper.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I promise you honest service, for the right price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A Gorgon is a half-snake, half-humanoid. They are notorious for their relentless pursuit of knowledge. Nakhash in particular is extremely interested in increasing his understanding of the races currently struggling for supremacy of Elemental, and has apparently determined that the best way to do so is to join with them for a time. Although it is hard to judge from his appearance, Nakhash claims to be very old - far older, in fact, than the oldest recorded mentions of his kind in any texts your sages can find, and to have studied the humanoid races off and on for much of that time. When asked about this, he merely points out that much lore has been lost, and that the mortal races were never the sole authors of history.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: The world has ended before. With time, I too may return to my former power and glory, but for now...
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will draw blood in your name for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Zlatxl was formerly a priest-king among the lizardmen, but left his people not long after the Cataclysm to travel and see what had happened to the land during its upheavals. When after some years time he returned, he found that his entire family had been ritually sacrificed by the current rulers in a ceremony intended to grant a boon to their newly re-expanding civilization. Reading the writing on the wall, Zlatxl decided that he deserved a more auspicious fate than to serve as a sacrificial victim, and quickly fled. Unfortunately, the current leaders of the lizardmen still view him as a threat, and once his return was made known to them, managed to apply a powerful blood-curse hex upon him that he has so far been unable to lift.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Do not fear me; or rather, know that my brothers and sisters will fear me more.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will show that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory: Somehow, during their flight from the dungeon dimensions, Ralruhanon was changed. She had previously been a unit commander of especially bloodthirsty shock troops, unswerving in her loyalty to the No-God. The loss of her leader left her shaken to her core. She decided to take stock. When she and the decimated remains of her unit fled through the gate, instead of re-forming them into a coherent fighting unit on the other side, she walked silently away, through the swirling chaos, out into the wilderness. There, on her own for the first time since birth, she pondered the meaning of her existence. After many weeks, amidst struggling to survive the various hostile forces roaming the lands, she came to the conclusion that she, and indeed her entire race, were in the wrong, did not belong to this world, and should depart immediately. Struggling to deal with the heretofore unfamiliar feelings of remorse, she applied what she knew and was born to; she decided to fight. This time, however, she would fight against her people. That this effort will likely lead to her own demise does not bother her. She is no fool, however, and now seeks an army to fight alongside.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Knowledge is a quarry that can be eternally pursued, but never overtaken.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will join your hunt!
UnitType.Backstory:
Ocanni was formerly a great spirit-shaman among the Drota. After the Stormlord rose to power, most other potential contenders for rule such as himself were hunted down and slain. Ocanni managed to escape this fate due to a quirk of circumstance. At the time of the Cataclysm, he had left his tribe to wander into the wilderness on a mystic vision quest. He spent most of that chaotic time dormant inside a deep cavern whose walls were covered with ancient shamanic inscriptions of his people, his body sleeping while his mind travelled on astral journeys. When he awoke, he found that he had somehow metamorphosed into spider-hybrid form. Upon returning to his tribe, he found that his people had been captured and enslaved by the Stormlord's faction.
Since that day, he has split his time between wandering the wild lands and hunting down members of the Stormlord's tribe. Now, however, he senses that changes are coming, and he wishes to pursue those changes and be a part of them.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: The forests cry out for vengeance, and I will give it to them.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d will show you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
Sergruthel was born before the Cataclysm, but took her name, which means 'Blood Anger', in its aftermath. Setting aside her old life (which was apparently unremarkable for an elf) she took up the sword and set about seeking to repay those who destroyed her people and the wildlands she loved. Times being what they are, she had many targets to select; local captains among various Fallen factions soon learned to fear the silent shadows. Sergruthel has had ample chance to refine her craft since those early days, and now ranges far and wide in search of suitable targets.
Other elves tend to find her grim nature and single-mindedness of purpose unsettling, so she has sought to join with those more actively pursuing her ends.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Let the world freeze. I'll survive.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d and I will freeze the hearts of your foes.
UnitType.Backstory: Since the Cataclysm, Skadi's heart has turned cold, even for a frost giant. She has spent most of her time since then in the wild lands, hunting dangerous prey and cursing the loss of her kith and kin.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: The only new world order is that which you impose yourself.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would show that you are sincere.
UnitType.Backstory:
At one point, Lochean, the golem leader of the White Golems, determined that it would be more expedient to destroy certain golems than to attempt to "convert" them. To that end, he created several new golems with special training in the destruction of other golems. As a safety precaution, they were not given free will, but instead were bound solely to Lochean's command. This was done in secret, for obvious reasons. Barael was one of these specially created golems.
During one mission to destroy some iron golems being utilized by a group of Ironeers, Barael was severely damaged. In fact, he was mistakenly reported as destroyed by the rest of his attack force; this, however, was not the case. In a later raid by conventional White Golem forces, Barael's body was discovered in a wrecked building and recovered for repair and treatment. As part the repairs, the golem restoring him, unaware of his special purpose and secret nature, ended up granting Barael self-control and free will.
After his recovery, Barael, disillusioned with the cause espoused by Lochean and the White Golems, took it upon himself to destroy the rest of his former unit, a task that he has successfully completed. So far as Barael is aware, Lochean has not seen fit to create another such clandestine group, though he has heard that the White Golems have authorized some units of golems to learn special disassembly tactics officially.
His point made, Barael now seeks to place his skills at the disposal of a new employer, though he has no illusions as to moral superiority; he merely seeks a competent leader to work with.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Life and Death are but two sides of the same coin.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar and my fate will be bound to yours.
UnitType.Backstory:
Morech is a shadow of ambiguous morality. He seeks knowledge of creation, destruction, restoration, and decay. He cares little for either means or ends, but only for knowledge gained thereby. Life, to him, is merely a spectrum of states of being through which to pass. From the time of his creation he has kept aloof from other shadows, and more recently that distance has been encouraged by leaders among the shadow community as they fear that he will taint their image.
That said, Morech has recently begun to back away from certain magical pursuits that some would describe as 'dark' or 'evil', as he has found that they tend to have unintended and frequently undesirable side effects.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Wine, women, and song. The first two are lost to me, so you'd better have some damn fine minstrels.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d Gildar will entice me.
UnitType.Backstory: Long ago, early in the rule of the dynasty that produced the being who became the Skeleton King, Kamek was a hero of legend. Recently, the Skeleton thought to revive the land's ancient heroes and enlist them in his service, beginning with Kamek. The experiment was of limited success. Kamek was re-awakened in undead form, but not bound to the command of the Skeleton King. Rather upset about being reawakened in this form (Kamek had been known for destroying a particularly nasty necromancer with a surprise fire dart back in his own day, and was no friend of the undead) Kamek has elected to take up adventuring again. He does complain that it's not the same now that he can't properly enjoy a celebratory feast and night in the brothels after a successful adventure, though.
